subtitleNullable: Immunization, Child Health, Substance Use, Universal Health Coverage, and more
descriptionNullable:
_____
# Saudi Arabia Health Indicators
### Immunization, Child Health, Substance Use, Universal Health Coverage, and more
By Humanitarian Data Exchange [[source]](https://data.world/humdata)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains valuable health indicators associated with Saudi Arabia from the World Health Organization's data portal. This data is critical in understanding and addressing public health issues related to mortality and global health estimates, sustainable development goals, millennium development goals (MDGS), service organization and delivery prevention programs and providers, child health, infectious diseases, human resources management systems, youth initiatives, noncommunicable diseases and mental health interventions. This multi-category information provides useful insights on complex interactions between mobility of populations across geographic regions as well as monitoring the progress of established international Health Regulations (2005). Additionally this database allows analysts to draw meaningful comparison through collecting data across sex groups plus essential technologies investments such as medical equipment evaluations. All this information has been collected from reliable sources-such as surveys or registry- for users to use it for analytical or research purposes only. It is important to note that the displayed values have been rounded off for better readability; therefore details about individual indicator metadata should be referred in their respective corresponding links provided within the dataset description 

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> 
> 
>    Alternatively, if instead of studying a single indicator like mortality rate alone, you are interested in several different ones across different categories at once – say mental health indicators alongside prevention programs - simply include all relevant columns while analyzing instead.    
>  
> Finally after having customized your analysis depending on which type indicators or how many types of indicators that interests you best; now its time to dive deep into statistical analysis using different tools available like Python Pandas library for data manipulation and plotting libraries like Matplotlib for visualization! Here’s some suggested Python code featuring some standard libraries:   
> 
>     import pandas as pd  #importing pandas library
> 
>     df = pdd.read_csv('/path/to/your/file') #loading csv file
> 
>     df['indicator'] = df['COMMENTS'] + dv['Display Value'] #Filtering out desired selections from comments column
> 
>     dv_stdDev = df[df['Std

### Research Ideas
> - Developing a predictive model for preventative health interventions targeting specific risk factors in Saudi Arabia's population, such as obesity or smoking.
> - Analyzing trends in the quality and quantity of health services provision and delivery in Saudi Arabia using the RSUD indicators.
> - Comparing global and regional differences in mortality rates, morbidity rates, and nutrition indicators across countries of the Arabian Peninsula to inform public health policymaking initiatives at local/national levels

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/humdata)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: noncommunicable-diseases-and-mental-health-indicators-for-saudi-arabia-44.csv**
| Column name                | Description                                                                                |
|:---------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**             | Global Health Observatory code for categorical classification. (String)                    |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**          | Global Health Observatory display name for categorical classification. (String)            |
| **GHO (URL)**              | URL for Global Health Observatory. (URL)                                                   |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**    | Status of published indicators with respect to quality assurance processes. (String)       |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)** | Display name for the status of published indicators. (String)                              |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**     | URL for the status of published indicators. (URL)                                          |
| **YEAR (CODE)**            | Year code for when measurements were taken. (Integer)                                      |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**         | Display name for the year code. (String)                                                   |
| **YEAR (URL)**             | URL for the year code. (URL)                                                               |
| **REGION (CODE)**          | Geographical location code. (String)                                                       |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**       | Display name for the geographical location code. (String)                                  |
| **REGION (URL)**           | URL for the geographical location code. (URL)                                              |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**         | Country code. (String)                                                                     |
| **STARTYEAR**              | Start year for the measurements. (Integer)                                                 |
| **ENDYEAR**                | End year for the measurements. (Integer)                                                   |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**      | Display name for the country code. (String)                                                |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**          | URL for the country code. (URL)                                                            |
| **SEX (CODE)**             | Gender code. (String)                                                                      |
| **SEX (DISPLAY)**          | Display name for the gender code. (String)                                                 |
| **SEX (URL)**              | URL for the gender code. (URL)                                                             |
| **Display Value**          | Quantified experiential most relevant signal from measurement i.e prevalence rate. (Float) |
| **Numeric**                | Raw number itself if available. (Float)                                                    |
| **Low**                    | Lowest value of the measurement. (Float)                                                   |
| **High**                   | Highest value of the measurement. (Float)                                                  |
| **StdErr**                 | Standard error away from mean values. (Float)                                              |
| **StdDev**                 | Standard deviation away from mean values. (Float)                                          |
| **Comments**               |                                                                                            |

_____
